intro: Euodia tenuistyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved euodia, is a small evergreen tree native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Euodia tenuistyla is often found in coastal and heathland environments, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
